nodes.diffHunk: @@ -73,3 +73,19 @@ This produces a browsable description of the cluster management service API: The cluster management service is available to Java clients via a Java API. To enable the cluster management service Java API, include `geode-management.jar` in your client classpath. See the [Cluster Management Service Java Client topic on the Geode Wiki](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/GEODE/Cluster+Management+Service#ClusterManagementService-JavaClient) for more details. + +## Authentication and Authorization + +The cluster management service REST API is secured by the security-manager of your cluster. If a security-manager is specified, by default, you will +need to pass in a username/password pair in order to invoke the rest api. + +``` +curl --user username:password http://example.com/management/regions +``` + +When security-auth-token-enabled-components is set to "all" or "management", you will +need to pass in a valid bear token in your request header in order to invoke the rest api.

nodes.bodyText: Why did you change "security-client-accessor" to "security-auth-token"? I don't see the latter in the product but the client-accessor one exists

Static creation method returning an AccessControl object, which determines authorization of client-server cache operations. This specifies the callback that should be invoked in the pre-operation phase, which is when the request for the operation is received from the client. S, L not set +security-auth-token-enabled-components +A comma delimited list of component names which works in conjunction with the security-manager property. if security manager is enabled, this property will determine what rest end point will use token based authentication instead of basic (username/password) authentication.
